column2: An extensible authentication and authorization library for Clojure Ring web applications and services.

0.3.0 changelog, readme tweaks
0.3.0-SNAPSHOT
eliminate "classic" OpenId workflow, gh-45

remove deprecated `requires-scheme*` middlewares,
long since superseded by https://github.com/ring-clojure/ring-ssl
replace `original-url` with `ring.util.request/request-url`, fixes gh-154
deprecate and un-document "channel security" stuff, pointing to ring-ssl (via ring-defaults for most)

0.2.2-SNAPSHOT

add :cemerick.friend/ensure-session option for workflow result meta,
allows a workflow to request no redirects *and* that the session should
be set. Fixes gh-83.

retrieve password same way as username

retrieve password same way as username

Update interactive-form workflow to check form-params for "password" key, as is done for username.

There is certainly a prettier way to handle both of these, but this should suffice.

Add example Nginx config to README.

This config demonstrates how to set the appropriate headers so that openid and oauth2 workflow return URLs are generated correctly.

0.2.1-SNAPSHOT
don't test on 1.2.x anymore, ring 1.2.0 final requires Clojure 1.3 because of tools.reader dep
add note on non-breakage of the API
0.2.0 changelog
bump to ring 1.2.0
now need to "fool" original-url in requires-scheme middleware
make util/original-url respect x-forwarded-proto/x-forwarded-port headers, when available
don't add parameters to return URL, and use same return-url mechanism on verification as we do on init

Merge pull request #74 from tavisrudd/master

workaround for openid reverse proxy redirect issue

make it possible to use friend.openid behind reverse proxies

The use of utils/original-url by openid.clj was leading to incorrect return urls.
- document the issue in utils/original-url
- add (:cemerick.friend.openid/return-url req) as an optional override
  to work around the issue.
- fix a potential issue with query string munging in openid/handle-init
- tiny whitespace fixes emacs insists on :)

fix whitespace issues

rm some tabs and trailing whitespace prior to a less annoying ;) patch to fix a proxy issue

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lynaghk/friend
openid works in servlet context

Allow :roles to be a function, which will be executed with no args and assumed to return a collection of roles each time user authorizations are checked.

This allows, e.g., promoting a user to a new role without forcing a logout+login.

Closes #21.

also removed scratch code and renamed fns

eliminate some silly reflection
0.1.3 changelog

* parameterize behaviour when responding to unauthenticated requests
  that require authentication (new :unauthenticated-handler option)
* don't automatically send http-basic denial when http-basic creds aren't provided
* fixes gh-38
patch around openid4java/guice maven repo absurdity
Always send absolute URIs on redirects, fixes gh-42
fix potential NPE introduced in previous commit
url-encode username passed to login-uri after failure
factor out separate `bcrypt-verify` fn
make it easy to use `current-authentication` with an identity or a Ring request map
Remove dead `credential-fn` code
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/PetrGlad/friend
Fix for cemerick/friend #32
draft 0.1.2 changelog
Allow empty usernames in HTTP Basic workflow, fixes gh-28
handle session state properly in the logout middleware, too
Can't use :refer in old Clojures! :-(
further tweaks to ensure proper handling of session state (gh-24, gh-26)
up to Ring 1.1.0, use its response? fn
only conditionally associate session to response (gh-24)
add test verifying gh-26 (and perhaps gh-24)
0.1.1 release
eliminate dead code
use clojure 1.4.0 by default; add 1.5.0 profile; project.clj cleanup
don't need separate slingshot predicate

Allow ::redirect-on-auth? to be a string indicating the URI to redirect
to
ignore pom.xml*
add support for credential function to return maps with custom password key
0.1.1-SNAPSHOT
set clojars as "releases" deployment repository
fix changlog formatting
release 0.1.0
add changelog
Use a core.cache TTL cache to avoid storing unprintable DiscoveryInformation objects in the ring session, ref gh-10, gh-11
OpenID workflow's :max-nonce-age now specified in ms, not seconds
Only emit www-authenticate challenge from http-basic workflow if (not :allow-anon?), ref gh-16
http-basic workflow now properly responds with www-authenicate challenge when no credentials are provided, fixes gh-16

Merge branch 'expose-logout' of https://github.com/jszakmeister/friend

Conflicts:
	src/cemerick/friend.clj
Use HTTP 401 instead of 403 to indicate unauthorized authenticated request, fixes gh-20

Tweaks to handle authorization failures more correctly (motivated
by discussion on gh-19):

* :unauthorized-redirect-uri is no longer used (was nonsensical)
* additional data may now be added to the stone thrown upon unauthorized access
* that data is now added to the request passed to :unauthorized-handler
* tweaks to keys for consistency
fix travis config
refer to `identity` properly
Updated Ring URI
Modified the method of setting default values in cemerick.friend/authenticate*

Expose logout*.

This makes it easier to integrate logging out with Noir.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/otfrom/friend

Merge pull request #9 from michaelklishin/patch-1

Test against multiple JDKs on travis-ci.org
Test against multiple JDKs on travis-ci.org

Added requires-scheme-with-proxy so that friend works with heroku,
elastic beanstalk and other load balancers that use
x-forwarded-proto.
add docs for make-auth, provide a metadata-less arity

Make it easier to create a 3rd party workflow.

I added a custom workflow to my application, and in the process ran into
the fact that I basically had to copy and paste username-as-identity,
and duplicate the (vary-meta ...) code.  This change factors out the
(vary-meta ...) code and makes it public.
generalize throw-unauthorized to merge any k/v pairs provided; use it in wrap-authentication too
follow common argument convention for ring middlewares, fixes gh-6
fix clj-http :dev-dep for lein 1.x.
make interactive form respect :login-uri specified in top-level authorize config
eliminate "pom" dependency, hopefully make compatible with Leiningen 1.x? (gh-5)
slightly better test feedback for openid verification
whoops

don't clobber metadata of returns from credential fns, etc.
